heading: 1.1 Course Description:
text: course covers descriptive basic inferential statistics, including graphs, frequency distributions, central tendency, dispersion, probability, hypothesis testing, tests mean differences, correlation simple regression, chi-square tests. Computer applications included.

heading: 1.2 Course Overview:
text: course designed provide students opportunity develop knowledge understanding various statistical concepts procedures. particular, hoped students leave course () recognition statistics fits within broader (quantitative) research process, (b) understanding assumptions associated different statistical procedures assumptions guide analytic choices, (c) understanding utilize tools (SPSS) order analyze quantitative data.

heading: 1.3 General Objectives:
text: able correctly identify variables falling different scales measurement.able correctly identify appropriate techniques analyzing data presented variables different measurement characteristics.able understand assumptions associated different statistical tests.able set manage databases containing variables.able carry statistical analyses data using SPSS.able correctly interpret results statistical analyses.able distinguish null alternative (research) hypotheses.able distinguish directional non-directional hypothesis.understand concepts "statistical significance" "effect size".understand effects sampling (e.g., size, strategies) inferences concerning population estimates.

heading: 2.1 R Studio
text:
RStudio integrated development environment R, programming language statistical computing graphics. available two formats: RStudio Desktop regular desktop application RStudio Server runs remote server allows accessing RStudio using web browser.
can download R studio : https://posit.co/download/rstudio-desktop/

heading: 3 Cross-references

heading: 3.1 Chapters and sub-chapters
text:
two steps cross-reference heading:Label heading: # Hello world {#nice-label}.

label un-numbered heading, use: # Hello world {-#nice-label} {# Hello world .unnumbered}.

heading: 3.2 Captioned figures and tables
text:
Figures tables captions can also cross-referenced elsewhere book using \@ref(fig:chunk-label) \@ref(tab:chunk-label), respectively.See Figure 3.1.
Figure 3.1: nice figure!
Don’t miss Table 3.1.Table 3.1: nice table!
code:
par(mar = c(4, 4, .1, .1))
plot(pressure, type = 'b', pch = 19)
knitr::kable(
  head(pressure, 10), caption = 'Here is a nice table!',
  booktabs = TRUE
)
